title: Are Open Educational Resources (OER) and MOOC the same thing? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. MOOC and OER are not same. OER are to do with learning material, the content. MOOCs, on the  other hand, are courses and a new model of teaching on-line to a wider  audience. So, the question is where the confusion arises from? Probably  the answer is in the word “OPEN”, which is there in both the terms.In OER, the word ‘Open’ refers to the ‘content’ of  the course or ‘learning material’. The author allows you to reuse,  revise, remix and redistribute the content. Further, the OER content is  open to the extent that you are free to do some ot more of these without  paying any fee or any royalties.On the other hand, the word “Open” in MOOC means  that the Course is open to any one i.e. any one can take the course  online. It does not say anything about the content of the course that  may or may not be have an open license.

No. MOOC and OER are not the same. OER deals with learning material, the content. MOOCs, on the other hand, is courses and a new model of teaching on-line to a wider audience. In OER, the word ‘Open’ refers to the ‘content’ of the course or ‘learning material’. The author allows you to reuse, revise, remix and redistribute the content. Further, the OER content is open to the extent that you are free to do some ot more of these without paying any fee or any royalties. On the other hand, the word “Open” in MOOC means that the Course is open to any one i.e. any one can take the course online. \It does not say anything about the content of the course that may or may not be have an open license. Open All the Way: MOOCs, OER, and Open Education

According to UNESCO (2002), OER refer to "the open provision of educational resources enabled by information and communication technologies, for consultation, use and adaptation by a community of users for non-commercial purposes" this educational resources consist of learning content, tools, and implementation resources that may reside in the public domain and have released under an intellectual property or open license such as creative commons that permits users with 4Rs framework - reuse, revise, remix, or redistribute to support knowledge building and sharing.  Whereas, MOOC (Massive Open Online Course) is one types of OER learning content, often used interchangeably with OER but not synonymous to OER. MOOC is a free online course without enrollment restrictions, which may be delivered via different web or platforms.

MOOCs are complete courses, with an instructor, course materials (including lectures and readings), assignments, and a community of students. Open Educational Resources can be as miniscule as a single lecture video, class session presentation, or book excerpt. MOOCs are great for an immersive, school-like educational experience, Open Educational Resources are useful for learners who prefer to pick and choose their learning content. Jessica MerrittOEDb.org
